description:
1) Get details of keypair by passing keyname using GET with the url = "/os-keypairs/keyname" 

Description: 
--------------- 
GET keypair details does not return the details.It raises 500 error. 

Expected result: 
------------------- 
Should return the details of keypair whose keyname is specified.

Actual result:
------------------
Returns error 500 (HTTP 'KeypairController' object has no attribute 'show' (HTTP 500)

Below is the log:
===============

title: GET details of a keypair returns 404 'NotFound'

comments.content:
1) Get details of keypair by passing keyname using GET with the url = "/os-keypairs/keyname" 

Description: 
--------------- 
GET keypair details does not return the details.It raises 500 error. 

Expected result: 
------------------- 
Should return the details of keypair whose keyname is specified.

Actual result:
------------------
Returns error 500 (HTTP 'KeypairController' object has no attribute 'show' (HTTP 500)

Below is the log:
===============

comments.content:
I don't know if it is a typo.  In your title, it is said the error code is 404, but in the content description, the error code is 500.

I looked into the code, "GET /os-keypairs/keyname" is not supported. And it is not documented in  http://api.openstack.org/. I don't know why you tried it. But it can be a wish list item. So I confirmed it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~daisy-ycguo

comments.content: This call is not supported. Please reopen a specific bug if what you actually want is to have future versions of the API support a "GET details of a keypair" call.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
